message: La Taqueria. 25th & Mission is awesome. The Little Chihuahua is really good too. It's on Divis.
24th and mission! near the bart.
My fave is Papalote - the amazing salsa and refried black beans...! Need I say more?
Papalote is great - but it's more the salsa than the burrito IMHO.  I also like Little Chihuahua.
Castillito on Mission if you're not even trying to be healthy. Though Papalote is great if you're in a healthier mood.
Al Pastor Super Burrito @ San Buena Taco Truck (22nd + Harrison)... craving one now...
Papalote hands down.
I'm partial to Farolito Taqueria on 24th & Mission
another vote for farolito

Taqueria San Francisco on 24th st is tasty: 
http://maps.google.com/maps/place?cid=15648744048279196571
Al Pastor @ the El Tonayense taco truck next to the Best Buy @ 14th & Harrison.
El Farolito on Mission
My favourite during Burritup was Taqueria Cancun at Mission & 19th, though I've long been a fan of Pancho Villa on 16th St.
But what's the best?
If we're ignoring Papalote, I've gotta go with the Grilled Prawn Super burrito at the southern Taqueria Cancún  (down mission, toward Heights)
@rodbegbie You should definitely check out the other two Cancun locations, as they are more consistent than the 19th street one (although less conveniently located for the 3am drunk munchies)
Another vote for El Farolito
Papalote +1
+1 to Taqueria Cancun at the Mission/Valencia intersection
the steak & prawn burrito at Pancho Villa is epic
I second or third Taqueria Cancun on Mission & 19th. Veggie burrito has always been consistently awesome and comatose inducing for me.
The Little Chihuahua http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-little-chihuahua-san-francisco. Carne Asada super burrito with refried black beans for the win.
Papalote +1
I'm going to have to go for La Taqueria Dos Amigos on Brannan. So good.
Farolito +1
This dude was eating one on the bus home and it smelled really good. I think he had the best one. You guys missed it!
Papalote +1
@ericflo I was rather unimpressed by the burrito... I think you're biased since it's close to your apt :P
@mttwrnr Farolito is a total 2am drunk burrito
I'm going to say an unpopular one but I stand by it: Jasmin's Cafe http://www.yelp.com/biz/jasmins-cafe-san-francisco
Papalote +1
@leah It's not consistently the best, but when it's good, it's *great* :)

I'll go even less known, Chunky's in the Tenderloin: http://www.yelp.com/biz/chunkys-taqueria-and-grill-san-francisco Their quesadilla is basically a giant tortilla bag filled with cheese, meat, sour cream, and guacamole. Its f-ing amazing. And the dudes who work there are all hilarious.

El Matate on Bryant and 22nd. They actually use seasonal vegetables, not tasteless tomatoes out of season. Farolito tastes like hot trash compared to this. http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-metate-san-francisco
http://cl.ly/0V092S190e1O1x2d1h2s/Screen_shot_2011-03-23_at_3.11.56_PM.png
@leah haha, how about a drunk 2pm burrito?
Drunk 2am burrito could get taco bell on this list.

If in the Mission, of course Farolito Taqueria at 24th & Mission.  In the Financial District it's a little harder to come by, but there's a truck worth trying, Los Compadres http://foursquare.com/venue/73050
@ericflo jasmin on bush? That's on my block so I'm already biased :) Have to try their burrito now!
@berryp yeah! :)
Why is it nobody told me about farolito when I was in SF - gutted
Just had a burrito in Marino on Hayes. It was great! Not just the burrito, but the whole meal.
@mttwrnr papalote +1
have you guys seen http://www.burritoeater.com/main.php ? seems to be a pretty good breakdown of SF Taquerias

Taqueria El Castillito on Church by Duboce, on the strength of their Al Pastor. Slightly sweet, good sized, juicy chunks of meat, best tasting I've had anywhere. Get it in a super burrito, and have them add jalapeños too (they're pickled, and awesome.) That combination wins all, though I haven't tried to get it made that way anywhere else yet.
I prefer Taqueria El Buen Sabor and Taqueria San Jose. Anyone who picks Papalote tends to be a noob or a transplant to the city because their burritos lack flavor and FLAVOR.
my place is taqueria los coyotes. 16th and mission.

Taqueria Los Coyotes has something called the California Burrito and it's incredible. It's pretty much an affront to traditional burritos everywhere, but well worth the sacrilege. Carne Asada + Avacado + French Fries = #winning
@joncrawford the last time I had a burrito like that was in Austria. I hope this heresy breezes through the inquisitorial trial by fire of my habituated palate.
@joncrawford - nice! sounds like a lot of San Diego burritos
[i need a burrito buddy, stat]
this friday is http://burritupsf2.eventbrite.com/
la taqueria +1
papalote -1
Cancun or farolito
El metate. I'm from LA, so take it with a grain of salt.
